verification.verifier: Marcel Gémez Ferrer, Marcel Gomez Environmental Consulting

product_description.product_description: Holcim Fuerte cement is recommended for preparing general-purpose concretes, and mortars that do not require high initial strength. Its controlled Tricalcium Aluminate (C3A) content of no more than 8%, provides a moderate heat of hydration which favors the reduction of surface cracking due to shrinkage, when the curing parameters are adequately controlled. The inclusion of high-grade Holcim Limestone gives it better attributes in terms of plasticity in the fresh state of the mixtures, and reduces the water requirement to reach the desired workability parameters.
recommended_uses: Structural type concretes: beams, columns, foundations
product_description.dangerous_substances_declaration: Declared products contain less than 0.1% or no hazardous substance from the Candidate list of Substances of Very High Concern updated 07/08/2021. All cement products comply with REACH Regulation (CE) No. 1907/2006.

lca_information.declared_unit: 1 ton of cement, bulk or bagged
lca_information.reference_service_life: Estimated to exceed 50 years for cement-based products; recommended shelf life for cement is 45 days under adequate storage conditions.
lca_information.time_representativeness: Production data from January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020; other reference data from Ecoinvent 3.6 database.

databases_and_software.software: Global Cement and Concrete Association (GCCA) Industry EPD tool for cement and concrete (V3.0)

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to Gate (modules A1-A3) according to PCR 2019:14 and EN 15804:2012+A2:2019. Modules C1-C4 and D excluded. Includes raw material extraction, energy and material consumption, manufacturing processes, packaging, and storage at manufacturing stage.

declared_modules.A2: Transport of raw materials to production site
declared_modules.A3: Clinker manufacturing and cement production (main process)

assumptions.transportation: Estimates of distances traveled for raw materials and supplies; land and maritime transport considered; travel and return distances for road transport included.
assumptions.primary_fuels_transport: Generic maritime transport assumed from Gulf Coast US to Costa Rica.
assumptions.carbon_emissions: Based on GCCA CO2 and energy protocol and stoichiometric calculations; emission factors from GCCA protocol.
assumptions.cut_off_rules: Flows can be omitted up to 1% of total mass of material inputs or energy content of fuels and energy.
assumptions.data_quality: Data recorded daily from production records; calorific values from laboratory analysis; data from single production site with local geographic and technological correlation; certified management systems ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, ISO 14064-1:2019, INTE B5:2016; quality control laboratory accredited under INTE/ISO 17025:2017; carbon footprint certified under INTE/ISO 14067:2019.
assumptions.allocation_rules: Allocation avoided when possible; production divided into clinker and cement; allocation by physical properties (mass) when needed; electrical energy allocated by process meters; common consumptions allocated by total annual clinker production; packaging paper allocated by subtracting bulk product weight.

lca_information.impact_assessment_methods: Characterization methods per EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 including IPCC (EF), WMO, ReCiPe, CML, AWARE, SETAC-UNEP, USEtox, LANCA.
lca_information.information_excluded: Environmental impact of infrastructure, construction, production equipment, tools, and personnel transport not accounted.

transport_and_installation.transport_of_raw_materials: Includes ground and maritime transport from local suppliers and outside national territory; distances estimated.
transport_and_installation.transport_of_fuels: Maritime transport assumed from Gulf Coast US to Costa Rica.

end_of_life.modules_C1_to_C4_and_D: Excluded from this EPD as product fulfills conditions of EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 that material is physically integrated and not separable at end of life, and does not contain biogenic carbon.

carbon_emission_context.carbon_emissions_from_calcination: Significantly reduced due to low clinker content formulation.
carbon_emission_context.carbon_emissions_from_waste_combustion_n: Represents almost 15% of emissions from calcination.
carbon_emission_context.carbon_emissions_from_waste_combustion_r: No results presented due to lack of calculation tools.

recycled_materials_handling.use_of_secondary_materials: Recovery and use of iron oxide waste (industrial origin) and glass waste (post-consumer and industrial origin) reduce demand for primary renewable resources.
recycled_materials_handling.use_of_alternative_fuels: Use of alternative fossil fuels from pre-classified municipal and industrial solid waste reduces traditional fossil fuel consumption.

waste_management.hazardous_waste: Managed internally as alternative fuels, not recorded as landfill or incineration output.
waste_management.non_hazardous_waste: Managed in local sanitary landfill; reduced by classification and separation for reuse, recycling, and energy recovery.
waste_management.components_for_reuse: Generated and separated waste from clinker manufacturing stage.
waste_management.materials_for_recycling: Scrap metal and other recyclable industrial waste generated on site; recovery of pallets for reuse.
waste_management.materials_for_energy_recovery: Waste treated as alternative fuels in clinker kiln; represents more than 350% of non-hazardous waste disposed indicator.

company_information.description: Operating in Costa Rica since 1964, committed to sustainability and becoming a Net Zero company by 2030 with focus on climate protection, water and biodiversity conservation, circular economy, and stakeholder quality of life.
certifications: ISO 14067 Greenhouse Gases for Products (Product Footprint)
company_information.production_site: Holcim Cement Plant, Agua Caliente de Cartago, Costa Rica

origin_of_raw_materials.limestone: Extracted in Agua Caliente de Cartago, Costa Rica
origin_of_raw_materials.pozzolana: Extracted in Llano Grande de Cartago, Costa Rica
origin_of_raw_materials.high_grade_limestone: Extracted in Azul de Turrialba, Costa Rica
origin_of_raw_materials.transport_distances: 17 km and 45 km from production plant respectively

additional_info.air_emissions_voc: Cement is inherently non-emitting of VOCs; no VOC emission testing required; to maintain this, concrete application must not include organic surface coatings, binders or sealers.
additional_info.differences_from_previous_versions: This is the first version of the Holcim Fuerte Cement EPD by Holcim Costa Rica.
